contentList.content: Oath of the Eldritch Hunt
You are sworn to the erradication of the unnateral, the aberrant, and the alien.
Eldritch
Oath of the Eldritch Hunt

Oath of the Eldritch Hunt paladins abide by the following tenets:

Endure the Hunt. Through unyielding resolve, withstand the strain of body and mind, for the hunt is long and relentless.

Temper the Blade. Slay only when necessary, for mindless bloodshed taints the soul, and the hunter may become the hunted.

Guard the Innocent. Bear the burden of corruption so others may remain pure, sacrificing your body and soul to protect those untouched by the alien horrors.
Failure to abide by their tenets will result in a paladin forsaking their Oath and becoming something very different.
Eldritch Prey

The hunter marks a creature as his prey. The hunter can teleport up to [2] to an unoccupied space within [3] of the target as a <LSTag Tooltip="Bonus_Action">bonus action</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">Weapon attacks</LSTag> against the marked target deal an additional [1].
Eldritch Prey

Harness the power of the Eldritch Hunt, teleporting up to [2] directly to your marked prey. The affected entity suffers <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> and takes an additional +[1] Psychic damage from weapon attacks.
Eldritch Prey
When this entity attacks its marked prey, it deals an additional +[1].
Can use a bonus action to reapply Eldritch Prey to another target.
Prey Slaughtered
Reapply Eldritch Prey

Marks a creature as prey. The caster can teleport up to [2] to an unoccupied space within [3] of the target as a bonus action. Weapon attacks against the marked target deal an additional [1] Psychic damage.
Spectral Slash

You send forth a spectral copy of yourself to strike down your foe, making a melee spell attack against a creature within [2] of you. On a hit, the target takes [1] damage of your weapon's damage type.
Spectral Slash

You send forth three spectral duplicates of yourself to strike down one or several enemies within [2] of you. Make a melee spell attack for each spectral duplicate. On a hit, a target takes [1] damage of your weapon’s damage type.
Aura of the Hunt

The hunter and any nearby allies gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against non-humanoids <LSTag Tooltip="Aberration">aberrations</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Fiend">fiends</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Fey">fey</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Celestial">celestials</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Monstrosity">monstrosities</LSTag>.
Aura of the Hunt

You and any nearby allies gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against non humanoids <LSTag Tooltip="Aberration">aberrations</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Fiend">fiends</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Fey">fey</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Celestial">celestials</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Monstrosity">monstrosities</LSTag>.

You gain a +[1] bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against non humanoids <LSTag Tooltip="Aberration">aberrations</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Fiend">fiends</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Fey">fey</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Celestial">celestials</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Monstrosity">monstrosities</LSTag>.
Aura of the Hunt
Spectral Fury
At 18th level, this range increases to [1] feet.
Eldritch Prey
When the hunter attacks its marked prey, it deals an additional +[1].
Hunt the Prey
Hunt the Prey
Hunt the Prey
Harness the power of the Eldritch Hunt, teleporting up to [1] directly to your marked prey. Stalk your target relentlessly for up to 10 turns, as long as the mark endures.
The hunter harness the power of the hunt, teleporting up to [1] directly to his prey.
Hunt the Prey
Harness the power of the Eldritch Hunt, teleporting up to [1] directly to your marked prey. Stalk your target relentlessly for up to 10 turns, as long as the mark endures.
Hunt the Prey
Harness the power of the Eldritch Hunt, teleporting up to [1] directly to your marked prey.
Evard's Grasp
Evard's Grasp

From the ground beneath you, dark, writhing tentacles emerge, wrapping tightly around your limbs and holding you in place. You cannot move or take actions until the end of your attacker’s next turn. Attacks against you are made with advantage.

When activated, ethereal tentacles emerge from beneath the target, dealing [1] damage and <LSTag Type='Status' Tooltip='PARALYZED'>holding</LSTag> them in place. The target is <LSTag Type='Condition' Tooltip='Restrained'>restrained</LSTag> and cannot move or react. Attacks against them are made with <LSTag Tooltip='Advantage'>advantage</LSTag> and all <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">attack rolls</LSTag> are maximized.
Oathbreaker Knight Helmet
Oath of the Eldritch Hunter Armour

The aura also grants you <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="TRUESIGHT">true sight</LSTag>, revealing any hidden, invisible, or disguised enemies within range. No creature can evade your sight, ensuring that you remain ever vigilant.
Additionally, if the target dies before the spell ends, you have 3 turns to mark a new creature without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
A high-speed rush attack with a range of [1], dealing <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">melee weapon</LSTag> damage upon contact.
Hunter Smite
Deals an additional [1] to aberrations and monstrosities.
Stolen Eldritch Gift

As a <LSTag Tooltip="Bonus_Action">bonus action</LSTag>, you use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ChannelDivinity">Channel Divinity</LSTag> to enhance your body beyond your mortal limits. For 10 minutes, you can add your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> modifier to any <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> checks that you make.
Stolen Eldritch Gift

As a <LSTag Tooltip="Bonus_Action">bonus action</LSTag>, you use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ChannelDivinity">Channel Divinity</LSTag> to enhance your body beyond your mortal limits. For 10 minutes, you can add your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> modifier to any <LSTag Tooltip="Athletics">Athletics</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Acrobatics">Acrobatics</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="Perception">Perception</LSTag> checks that you make.
Additionally, if the target dies before the spell ends, you can mark a new creature without expending a <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag>.
Casting this spell at a higher level grants [1] extra range for each <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">Spell Slot</LSTag> Level above 1st.
Relentless Pursuer
Relentless Pursuer
Relentless Pursuer
Relentless Pursuer
Whenever you strike a marked target, you draw strength from your enemy to fuel the hunt, restoring [1] hit points.
Each time you are struck by this relentless hunter, you feel your strength falter, as if your very essence fuels their resolve.

The hunter marks its prey with the relentless hunger of the hunt. For the next minute, each time you strike the marked target, your body feeds on the bloodshed, restoring <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> modifier plus your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. The more you endure, the stronger you become, pushing beyond your limits.
Harness this relentless energy to sustain yourself as you pursue your quarry.
Each time you are struck by this relentless hunter, you feel your strength falter, as if your very essence fuels their resolve.
Whenever the hunter strikes its prey, the hunter draws strength from his prey to fuel the hunt, restoring [1] hit points.
Whenever the hunter strikes a marked target, the hunter draws strength from his enemy to fuel the hunt, restoring [1] <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag>.
Additionally, if you attack the market target with a <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Smite_Divine">Divine Smite</LSTag> your heal is doubled.
Perfected Hunter

The hunter is the embodiment of the eldritch of the hunt, none can get in the way of his kill. As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you activate the power of the true hunter. For the next minute you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HUNTER_INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>, you can't be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralysed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag> and your weapon attacks deal an additional [1].
Hunter Invisiblity
Entity has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>. Attack Rolls against it have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>.
Perfected Hunter

You are the embodiment of the eldritch hunt, none can get in the way of your kill. You are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HUNTER_INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>, you can't be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralysed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag> and your weapon attacks deal an additional [1].
Perfected Hunter

The hunter become the embodiment of eldritch annihilation, none can get in the way of your kill. As a <LSTag Tooltip="BonusAction">bonus action</LSTag>, you activate the power of the true hunter. For the next minute you are <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HUNTER_INVISIBILITY">Invisible</LSTag>, you can't be <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralysed</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RESTRAINED">Restrained</LSTag> or <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="GRAPPLED">Grappled</LSTag> and your weapon attacks deal an additional [1].
Unrelenting Pursuit
Allows the hunter to teleport to its prey when they move more than [1] away and attack him.
Unrelenting Pursuit
Allows you to teleport to your marked prey and make an attack if they move a certain distance away
Relentless Step
Allows you to teleport to your marked prey and make an attack if they move a certain distance away
Unrelenting Pursuit Setup
Allows the hunter to teleport to your his prey and make an attack if they move [1] away.
Relentless Pursuit

After using Hunt the Prey, if the hunter's marked target moves more than [1] away from him, the hunter can use his <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to teleport directly to its prey. Immediately make a <LSTag Tooltip="MeleeWeaponAttack">melee weapon attack</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Unrelenting Pursuit Aura
Unrelenting Pursuit Trigger
AURA
DAMAGE BOOST
Hunt the Prey
